name: Lithic Spear
desc: A spear forged from the rocks of the Guyun Stone Forest. Its hardness knows no equal.

materials.name: Mora
materials.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

materials.name: Grain of Aerosiderite
materials.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
A black meteor once fell beyond Liyue's Sea of Clouds, said to have fallen to vanquish a monster. However, it was stained by powerful tainted blood, so this item no longer possesses the pure power of Rex Lapis.

materials.name: Fragile Bone Shard
materials.desc:
A bone shard once carried by a Geovishap.
Although they are quite fragile, they seem to still harbor some indescribable power.

materials.name: Firm Arrowhead
materials.desc: A roughly produced arrowhead. Though unimpressive, neither it nor the bow should be underestimated, for even the bravest knight can be felled by an arrow from the rear.

materials.name: Mora
materials.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

materials.name: Piece of Aerosiderite
materials.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
Rumors of sea monsters are commonplace in Liyue, since the other shore is an unknown region that lies outside of Teyvat. Without the protection of The Seven, all that lies beyond is unknown chaos. Only power beyond the order of Teyvat is able to stain the power of Rex Lapis black.

materials.name: Fragile Bone Shard
materials.desc:
A bone shard once carried by a Geovishap.
Although they are quite fragile, they seem to still harbor some indescribable power.

materials.name: Firm Arrowhead
materials.desc: A roughly produced arrowhead. Though unimpressive, neither it nor the bow should be underestimated, for even the bravest knight can be felled by an arrow from the rear.

materials.name: Mora
materials.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

materials.name: Piece of Aerosiderite
materials.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
Rumors of sea monsters are commonplace in Liyue, since the other shore is an unknown region that lies outside of Teyvat. Without the protection of The Seven, all that lies beyond is unknown chaos. Only power beyond the order of Teyvat is able to stain the power of Rex Lapis black.

materials.name: Sturdy Bone Shard
materials.desc:
A fragment of an unknown creature's bones that appear to be prized by Geovishaps for some reason.
The fragment appears to be quite aged. Despite being dragon-like beasts with no spoken language, they still seem to have some sort of special affection for these bone shards.

materials.name: Sharp Arrowhead
materials.desc: A well-made arrowhead. Sharp enough to penetrate armor with the ease of a rock through the surface of water.

materials.name: Mora
materials.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

materials.name: Bit of Aerosiderite
materials.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
The coastal nations of Teyvat refer to the region beyond the protection of The Seven as the Dark Sea. It is said that many defeated gods refused to live under the new order of The Seven, so they fled to remote islands and became evil gods. However, their powers came from the same source as Rex Lapis, separate from this all-devouring darkness.

materials.name: Sturdy Bone Shard
materials.desc:
A fragment of an unknown creature's bones that appear to be prized by Geovishaps for some reason.
The fragment appears to be quite aged. Despite being dragon-like beasts with no spoken language, they still seem to have some sort of special affection for these bone shards.

materials.name: Sharp Arrowhead
materials.desc: A well-made arrowhead. Sharp enough to penetrate armor with the ease of a rock through the surface of water.

materials.name: Mora
materials.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

materials.name: Bit of Aerosiderite
materials.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
The coastal nations of Teyvat refer to the region beyond the protection of The Seven as the Dark Sea. It is said that many defeated gods refused to live under the new order of The Seven, so they fled to remote islands and became evil gods. However, their powers came from the same source as Rex Lapis, separate from this all-devouring darkness.

materials.name: Fossilized Bone Shard
materials.desc:
A fossilized bone fragment sometimes found after defeating Geovishaps.
Geovishaps all dream of growing into great dragons one day. They see these fossils as dragon bones and greatly cherish them, perhaps because they too hope to attain the dragons' longevity and power.

materials.name: Weathered Arrowhead
materials.desc:
An old arrowhead coated in blood. The arrowhead has long since lost its sharpness and thus its use as a weapon.
However, it represents the pride of a hunter and acts as both an amulet and a medal.

materials.name: Mora
materials.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

materials.name: Chunk of Aerosiderite
materials.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
When Khaenri'ah was destroyed, a great sinner created endless monsters with dark, alien blood flowing through their veins. They rampaged across the land, destroying all in their paths. They were mutated lifeforms, and the mutations were caused by powers from beyond this world. The black serpentine dragon Durin that attacked Mondstadt was one such mutated being.

materials.name: Fossilized Bone Shard
materials.desc:
A fossilized bone fragment sometimes found after defeating Geovishaps.
Geovishaps all dream of growing into great dragons one day. They see these fossils as dragon bones and greatly cherish them, perhaps because they too hope to attain the dragons' longevity and power.

materials.name: Weathered Arrowhead
materials.desc:
An old arrowhead coated in blood. The arrowhead has long since lost its sharpness and thus its use as a weapon.
However, it represents the pride of a hunter and acts as both an amulet and a medal.

desc.text:
A weapon favored by the Millelith of yore.
Made from a lith of the Guyun Stone Forest, said to be able to pierce even through dragon scales...
Its great weight prevents the Millelith of today from equipping it.
In ancient times, the Millelith would conduct themselves in Rex Lapis' name according to this axiom:
"While rock stays hard, the mountain shall never fail; while the Millelith stands guard, evil shall never prevail."
In the past, they went forth to subdue demons and protect the roads and the countryside.
In these peaceful times, their duties have shifted to maintaining order.
At a certain point in the past, the earth did shake, and the mountains did tremble.
Then, the Millelith gave out equipment left over from the ancient wars to those among them who were of unusually great stature.
These were the incredibly weighty Lithic Spears, and they were used as shoveling tools to rescue the injured.
"The Lithic Spear pierces through rock with ease."
"If a thousand such spears could be lined up in formation today, none could stand before them."
Yet in an even earlier era, when the world was in yet deeper turmoil,
Every soldier in the Millelith could wield these colossal weapons.
Thus were they able to protect Rex Lapis' kingdom and defend their homeland.
With a thousand Lithic Spears lined up in formation, no evil could prevail against them.

value.text: For every character in the party who hails from Liyue, the character who equips this weapon gains a <color=#37ffff>7%/8%/9%/10%/11%</color> ATK increase and a <color=#37ffff>3%/4%/5%/6%/7%</color> CRIT Rate increase. This effect stacks up to 4 times.

value.name: Lithic Spear
value.desc:
Evil Shall Never Prevail: Lithic Spear

These spears were forged from the rocks of the Guyun Stone Forest, and were favored by the Millelith of old. Their hardness knows no equal.

customize.name: Crimson Moon’s Semblance
customize.desc: A keen-edged weapon, luster dazzling as the crimson moon. It is said that an ancient dynasty once regarded it as a ritual object that could bridge two worlds, but none still remember the beliefs and ceremonies of that bygone age.

customize.name: Absolution
customize.desc: A rapier once wielded by a deceiver who had forsaken everything. In the past, it was primarily used as a tool when he had to disguise his identity.

customize.name: Sacrificial Bow
customize.desc: A ceremonial hunting bow that has become petrified over time. The trinkets on it are still visible. It grants the wielder the power to withstand the winds of time.

customize.name: Lion's Roar
customize.desc: A sharp blade with extravagant carvings that somehow does not compromise on durability and sharpness. It roars like a lion as it cuts through the air.

customize.name: The Widsith
customize.desc: A heavy notebook filled with musical scores. Though suffering from moth damage and heavy wear-and-tear, there is still much power to be found among the hand-written words within.

customize.name: Lithic Spear
customize.desc: A spear forged from the rocks of the Guyun Stone Forest. Its hardness knows no equal.

customize.name: Rainslasher
customize.desc: A fluorescent greatsword with no sharp edge that crushes enemies with brute force and raw power.

customize.name: Absolution
customize.desc: A rapier once wielded by a deceiver who had forsaken everything. In the past, it was primarily used as a tool when he had to disguise his identity.

customize.name: Light of Foliar Incision
customize.desc: The gilded blade was made using precious white branches. It was once used to destroy countless poisons that infested the forest.

customize.name: The Stringless
customize.desc: A bow that once served as an extraordinary instrument. It is no longer capable of getting people up and dancing.

customize.name: Sacrificial Sword
customize.desc: A ceremonial sword that has become petrified over time. The trinkets on it are still visible. It grants the wielder the power to withstand the winds of time.

customize.name: Sacrificial Fragments
customize.desc: A weathered script, the text of which is no longer legible. A cursed item eroded by the winds of time.

customize.desc: The lamp illuminates the dreams that float up over a thousand nights, and in its emerald-green light flows a song of ancient days.

customize.name: Wolf's Gravestone
customize.desc: A longsword used by the Wolf Knight. Originally just a heavy sheet of iron given to the knight by a blacksmith from the city, it became endowed with legendary power owing to his friendship with the wolves.

customize.name: Staff of Homa
customize.desc: A "firewood staff" that was once used in ancient and long-lost rituals.

customize.desc: A ceremonial sword masterfully carved from pure jade. There almost seems to be an audible sigh in the wind as it is swung.

customize.name: Summit Shaper
customize.desc: A symbol of a legendary pact, this sharp blade once cut off the peak of a mountain.

customize.name: The Unforged
customize.desc: Capable of driving away evil spirits and wicked people alike, this edgeless claymore seems to possess divine might.

customize.name: Polar Star
customize.desc: A pristine bow that is as sharp as the glaciers of the far north.

customize.name: Amos' Bow
customize.desc: An extremely ancient bow that has retained its power despite its original master being long gone. It draws power from everyone and everything in the world, and the further away you are from that which your heart desires, the more powerful it is.
